result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel E. Bliss was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Daniel E. Bliss is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Daniel E. Bliss was found guilty of Possess/Distribute Recording of Nudity [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "I" Felony], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 942.09(2)(am)3.
  • Daniel E. Bliss was found guilty of Intent. Contribute/Delinquency Child [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.40(1).
  • Daniel E. Bliss was found guilty of Computer Message-Threaten/Obscenity [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "B"], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.0125(2)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 5/11/2021 ORDER extending term of probation by 12 mths or until completion of Sex Offender Treatment.

miscConds.notes: Defendant to pay costs, crime victim witness surcharge and supervision fees over the course of probation as determined by agent.
Defendant is to have absolutely NO access to computers or access to the internet during probation by any means.

Defendant to follow all recommendations and conditions of probation set forth by the Department of Corrections, including any added at Department's discretion. 

Defendant to undergo any counseling or classes as recommended by probation agent. 

Defendant is to be registered as a sexual offender for five years upon conclusion of probation.

timeConds.notes: No sentence credit. With huber so long as reports and remains alcohol and controlled substance free.

For the duration of probation.
5/11/2021 ORDER vacating the condition of GPS/Electronic monitoring

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

superMiscConds.notes: DOC Probation & Parole indicates on the 2/11/22 Order for Revocation that "there are no outstanding financial obligations owed".
Defendant shall undergo and successfully complete all  treatment and counseling as agent deems appropriate, taking into account the defendant's intellectual disabilities.

Transcript - Sentencing - May 20, 2022
Honorable FAUN M. PHILLIPSON
PAIGE REARDON, District Court Reporter
Letter from Nadine W.R. dated 5/17/2022

10:03 AM  Defendant Daniel E. Bliss in court, in custody with Attorney Jane Krueger Smith in court.  Attorney Craig Nolen in court for State of Wisconsin. State complied with Victim Witness Notification. DA Nolen indicates there are no victims present to address the court.  Atty Krueger Smith indicates that DEs mother appears in person and would like to address the court.  Court recites case status as to revocation order and warrant.  Atty Krueger Smith asks the court disregard any compass evaluation for reasons cited on the record.  Letter 5/17/22 composed by Nadine W.R. is presented and read on the record.  Mother of DE, M.S., makes a statement to the court.  DA Nolen makes a statement as to sentencing recommendation.  Atty Krueger Smith makes a statement as to sentencing recommendation.  Daniel Bliss makes a statement to the court.  Break at 10:39 a.m. for court.  Case reconvenes at 10:49 a.m.  Court disposition as to Count 1 - sentencing after revocation of probation.    212 days credit.  Defendant advised of post conviction relief.
Request for Access to PSI
Sentencing hearing on revocation on May 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on May 4, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Order and Amendment to Judgment of Conviction in Probation Cases

Daniel E. Bliss, defendant appeared in Court in person with counsel Guy Mason Taylor by video means. Craig Nolen appeared by video means as prosecuting attorney. Probation Agent Leck  by video means.DA Nolen addresses probation extension request for treatment.  SPD Taylor addresses the court as to no basis for request.  Agent Leck addresses the court as to extension request. COURT - grants request for up to 1 year extension or until completion of treatment. Parties address the GPS monitoring. COURT - withdraws the requirement for GPS monitoring under the current circumstances. Probation is to resubmit the order for the court's signature.

Daniel E. Bliss, defendant appeared in Court in person with counsel Timothy J Burns. Gary L. Luhman appeared as prosecuting attorney. Defendant is waiving his preliminary hearing. The Court permits the Defendant to waive his preliminary hearing. Defendant is bound over for trial. Information filed; same charges and penalties. Defendant given complaint.   Defendant waives reading of complaint. Defendant stands mute, Court enters not guilty plea on defendants behalf.

Daniel E. Bliss, defendant appeared in Court in person with counsel Timothy J Burns. Gary L. Luhman appeared as prosecuting attorney. Dr. Craig Schoenecker is sworn in and testifies. He identifies the Defendant. Dr. Schoenecker informs the Court that he has found the Defendant competent. Court finds the Defendant competent to stand trial. Mr Luhman informs the Court that a preliminary hearing needs to be set in this case.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 9, 2015 at 11:00 am.
to modify bond to allow travel to Dane, Rock and lafayette Counties.

Daniel E. Bliss, defendant appeared in Court in person with counsel Timothy J Burns. Gary L. Luhman appeared as prosecuting attorney. State advises the Court that it will need an extension for a continuation of the hearing due to defense obtaining their own doctor for an evaluation. Court grants extension. New report to be due by September 14, 2015. Dr. Craig Schoenecker is sworn in and testifies by phone means. Dr Schoenecker has evaluated Mr Bliss twice and has now found him competent to stand trial. Continuation hearing is set for September 29, 2015 at 10:45 am.

Violation: 4 counts -Possess Child Porn; 1 count of Felony Intent to Contribute/Delinquency.
 Iss. Agency:  Wisconsin Department of Justice Division of Criminal Investigations.
Conditions: May not leave state of Wisconsin or Green County without permission of Court, while case is pending.   NO CONTACT WITH: any persons under the age of 18 years old. May not possess or use any computer device or video device or still picture camera except may use cell phone - not the camera device.  Defendant to continue his treatment in the Outpatient Competancy Restoration Program in Monroe.
to continue competency hearing and for independant evaluation of competency

Daniel E. Bliss, defendant appeared in Court in person with counsel Timothy J Burns. Gary L. Luhman appeared as prosecuting attorney. Mr Burns motions for bond conditions for Mr. Bliss to attend a church camp with his mother. His mother testifies regarding the camp activities and supervision of Mr Bliss. Mr Luhman objects due to minors in Yellowstone Park. Court denies motion for bond modification. Mr Burns indicates that the defendant is looking into getting a second phycological report from another doctor.  Competency hearing scheduled for July 17, 2015 at 01:15 pm. Bond continues.
